newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: HSBC, Czech Zivno win Interkontakt IPO mandate.
newsitem.headline: HSBC, Czech Zivno win Interkontakt IPO mandate.

text.p: Czech bank Zivnostenska Banka a.s. said on Thursday it won a mandate together with HSBC Investment Bank plc to arrange an initial public share offering for Czech retail chain Interkontakt Group.
The plan calls for an equity offering of up to a nominal one billion crowns in new stock, to be issued in September, Zivnostenska's Director of Capital Markets Department Martin Kryl said.
"A contract has been signed between Zivnostenska, HSBC and Interkontakt for coordinating the issue," Kryl told Reuters. He said that part of the issue would be placed on a foreign stock market.
"It is expected that there should be a foreign tranche (of the shares)," Kryl said. He did not elaborate.
Interkontakt Group a.s. is a privately-held Czech company which operates about 200 grocery, chemist and consumer products outlets in the Czech Republic and Slovakia.
It is also involved in a joint venture preparing to open 80 more stores ovr the next two years.
The group's 1996 turnover was 13 billion crowns, according to CTK news agency.
Interkontakt's director Jan Tlacbaba declined to provide further information on the company when contacted by Reuters.
Interkontakt's issue would be one of the first IPOs on the Czech market. Another company planning to go public is the fast-growing Czech music and entertainment group Bonton a.s..
